name: (2E)-1-(4-Hydroxyphenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-2-propen-1-one
Reason: The target compound, (2E)-1-(4-Hydroxyphenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-2-propen-1-one, has several functional groups influencing its melting point. Starting with a base structure of chalcone which has a melting point of approximately 56 degrees Celsius, we add the effects of each group: - Hydroxy group on the phenyl ring: +50 (increased hydrogen bonding capabilities and polarity) - Methoxy group on the other phenyl ring: +30 (electron-donating effect increasing stability and a minor increase in molecular weight) - Conjugated double bond system in propenone: +35 (increased molecular rigidity and planarity) - Ketone functional group: +25 (strong intermolecular dipole-dipole attraction due to the polar carbonyl group) These increments collectively elevate the melting point due to their individual effects on molecular stability, rigidity, or intermolecular interactions.
